page.title: 04 GREEN BELT-BIRTHDAY WOOD
page.content: {The Metropolitan Green Belt} was instituted to protect areas of "Great Landscape Value" surrounding urban cities and the countryside around. Much of the attractive woodland in this area owes its continued existence to this legislation. {Birthday Wood}- on private land at Hillside Farm, Rushmore Hill, is a good example and has one very interesting tree within it,a {Californian Redwood}, known locally as {"the Birthday Tree"}, planted to mark the birth of a child, children call it the "Punch tree" because of its soft, resilient bark. The tree is quite a height but not yet the size of those in California that are over 320 feet high and 3000 years old. The flora in Birthday Wood is prolific and some rare specimens such as the "Lady Slipper Orchid" have been reported.
